main event: Several sightings of unidentified flying objects (UFOs) were reported in 1952 in Lavallette, New Jersey. The objects were observed hovering over houses, making strange movements, and displaying unusual lighting patterns.
interesting points: Multiple parties observed the UFO hovering over their houses, occasionally landing in a nearby field but not traveling any further.
The object was described as slightly larger than an ordinary star, possibly brighter, and appeared to remain stationary for a few minutes, occasionally making small up and down movements.
The objects seen in the sky on July 20, 1952, were described as two moving lights, approximately round and orange-yellow in color with dull red diffusing over much of the surface.
The behavior of the object reported on August 21, 1952, included traveling at a high rate of speed, coming to a complete stop, hovering, and displaying a reddish-orange glow.
Witnesses reported that the objects observed appeared to travel in a straight line, then suddenly changed direction before disappearing from sight.
photographs: no, the report does not mention any photographs
